message.content:
cs.CL, cs.SI, cs.IR, cs.CY, cs.CR 

This paper deals with natural and man-made disasters and proposes a model for automatically identifying events from local news sources that may break on a global scale within the next 24 hours. This involves analyzing media coverage of disasters and using social media signals to detect such stories in their early stage of development. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language) as it deals with natural language processing and information retrieval. The paper also involves data collection and analysis, which falls under cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) and cs.IR (Information Retrieval). The paper also deals with cybersecurity and potential geo-political relevance, which falls under cs.CY (Computers and Society) and cs.CR (Cryptography and Security).
